text: Jonathan David Gallardo (born 28 February 1997) is an Argentine professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Sportivo Las Parejas. ==Career== Gallardo started his career with Sportivo Las Parejas. He began featuring for their first-team at the age of sixteen, featuring five times in Torneo Argentino B campaigns in 2013 and 2014. In January 2014, Gallardo had trials in Chilean football. His parent club won promotion in the following 2015 campaign, though Gallardo didn't play for them as he spent the year out on loan in Primera División side Unión Santa Fe's youth. Seven goals, including two against Gimnasia y Esgrima, in sixty-four fixtures back with Sportivo Las Parejas in all competitions subsequently came in the 2016, 2016–17 and 2017–18 tier three seasons. Ahead of 2018–19, Gallardo completed a loan move to Primera B Nacional's Villa Dálmine; penning a season-long deal in May 2018. His bow for Villa Dálmine arrived on 28 July in the Copa Argentina against River Plate, which preceded his league debut in September versus Chacarita Juniors. He remained for the 2019–20 campaign, where he took his overall tally for the club to twenty-six games.
